column1: #Text=Republic win 2-1 against Togo in Group G
#Text=Togo made the Korean Republic sweat , but two spectacular goals gave Dick Advocat 's men the win in Group G , Tuesday .
#Text=In the first half the result looked like it might go Togo 's way ; the team , on its debut appearance at the World Cup , had the better of a slow game and went into the break 0-1 up .
#Text=Passes were at walking speed in the Commerzbank Arena , Frankfurt , as both sets of players seemed to struggle with the stifling heat .
#Text=With the snow-roof closed for television conditions approached something like a sauna .
#Text=The goal for Otto Pfister 's side was scored by Kader on 31 minutes .
#Text=Between two defenders , Kader took a ball delivered from the right wing , which he deflected into the penalty area with his thigh .
#Text=Kader ran on to the ball and fired low across the keeper ; it went in off the right post .
#Text=Mohamed Kader arguably was Togo 's outstanding player of the match and caused trouble for Korean Republic in the second half with his pacey runs .
#Text=But a second half substitution and a sending off favoured the 2002 tournament 's semi-finalists to stage a come back .
#Text=The Korean Republic upped the speed of their short passing game and when midfielder Ji Sung Park , 30 yards from goal , turned and beat Jean-Paul Abalo a chance for the equaliser looked on .
#Text=The Togolese defender hacked down the surging winger Park , who plays his club football for Manchester United .
#Text=He was given a second booking and sent off .
#Text=Issued by Graham Poll , this was the second red card of the 2006 World Cup in Germany .
#Text=The goal came direct from the freekick ; on 54 minutes Chun Soo Lee used his right foot to send the ball with pace and bend beyond Kossi Agassa .
#Text=With the Korea Republic playing against 10 men the game opened up .
#Text=But Togo , though it had just 36 per cent of ball possession in the game , was not a push over .
#Text=The West African team mounted a number of dangerous counterattacks .
#Text=On 63 minutes the energetic Moustapha Salifou was in space on the edge of the area but could not keep his shot down .
#Text=Seven minutes later Dick Advocat 's half time substitute , veteran Jung Hwan Ahn , added another Korean example to the textbook of how to shoot from long range .
#Text=Wider to the right than Chun Soo Lee 's the 30-year-old drove it over Agassa into the same right corner .
#Text=The Korea Republic came into the tournament on bad form , which included a 3-1 loss to Ghana .
#Text=But to beat Togo Dick Advocat 's side had to improve during the match , which might give them confidence against France and Switzerland , also in Group G.
#Text=Korea Republic 2 – 1 Togo Commerzbank-Arena Chun Soo Lee 53 ' Jung Hwan Ahn 72 ' Kader 31 '
